Articles.Content: I dont know about you, but when I am not playing Kerbal Space Program I am off flying various planes in FSX. Who else does this, and do you feel that playing flight sims helped you get ready to fly rockets in KSP?

I do, and no.

My introduction to FS was with Bruce Artwick's v1.0 ... it's come a long way.

Been very much on and off with FSX. Still haven't completed my x-country Canadian tour though... One day when spare time and willpower is plenty. I have played various flight sims since very simplistic sims on the Commodore 64. Solo Flight, anyone?

As for preparing for flying anything in KSP, I'd say no unless a player comes into the sim world with no concept at all about flight sims. Even then it's going to be limited to figuring out that you can pitch the nose up and down etc. Flight physics in KSP is very kerbal indeed. For the rocket part, might as well prepare with Pac Man, just as useful as any filght sim.

Mine was the PC version. I still have the floppy (somewhere). Not too too long ago I had it running on my old Compaq portable (all 30-some-odd-lbs of it), 4 inch green mono screen. My favorite bug in V1.0 was to roll over and dive inverted... you'd gain altitude like mad lol.

I muck around on FSX.

I'd have to say that flying a plane in FSX is very different from flying a rocket in KSP.  I find flying a plane in KSP is different from FSX, as well.

I played Chuck Yeager's Flight Sim on my IBM clone way back in the early 90's. Shooting for the moon in an SR-71 in amber monochrome, woohoo! I think I may have even landed it once.

Other than that I played quite a bit of Combat Flight Simulator 3 on PC, but never played FSX or anything else in that series. I got fairly proficient in that, and flying was much easier than in KSP. Lots of fun with infinite ammo, chaining a string of 1000lb bombs across the countryside. Even with my joystick, I find that KSP flight is too twitchy.
